title: Mini Test 20: Superlatives
description: Practice superlative forms (am größten, der beste) - attributive and predicate

questions.explanationDetail: Before a noun (attributive), use: der/die/das + adjective + -ste/-este. Das beste Buch (the best book). Gut → beste (irregular). Attributive superlatives decline like adjectives.
After a verb (predicate), use: am + adjective + -sten/-esten. Sie singt am schönsten (she sings the most beautifully). Schön → am schönsten. Predicate superlatives use 'am'.
Before a noun: die größte Stadt (the biggest city). Groß → größte (with umlaut). Attributive superlatives: der/die/das + adjective + -ste + ending.
After a verb: am schnellsten (the fastest). Er läuft am schnellsten (he runs the fastest). Predicate superlatives always use 'am + -sten'.
Before a noun: der längste Tag (the longest day). Lang → längste (with umlaut). Attributive form needs adjective ending after -ste.
Gern → lieber → am liebsten (gladly → more gladly → most gladly). Ich esse am liebsten Pizza (I like eating pizza the most). Irregular superlative.
Before a noun: das teuerste Auto (the most expensive car). Teuer → teuerste. Adjectives ending in -er/-el drop the -e: teuer → teu(e)rste.
Viel → mehr → am meisten (much → more → most). Er arbeitet am meisten (he works the most). Irregular superlative, predicate form.
Before a noun: die beste Lösung (the best solution). Gut → beste (irregular). Attributive superlatives need adjective endings: beste (fem. nom.).

questions.text: Dieser Weg ist ___ als der andere.
questions.explanationDetail: Kurz → kürzer (shorter). One-syllable adjectives often add umlaut: kurz → kürzer. Dieser Weg ist kürzer (this path is shorter). Use with als.
